Detailed Description

Abstract base class for all task synchronization object.

Member Function Documentation

void ASyncObject::Attach ( xGenericHandle  handle) [virtual]

Attach the object to a given FreeRTOS handle. A previous attached handle is deleted and its resource are freed.

Parameters:
handlespecifies a native FreeRTOS handle.

Implements IFreeRTOSObj.

Referenced by CBinarySemaphore::CBinarySemaphore(), CCountingSemaphore::CCountingSemaphore(), CMutex::CMutex(), CRecursiveMutex::Create(), CMutex::Create(), CCountingSemaphore::Create(), CBinarySemaphore::Create(), and CRecursiveMutex::CRecursiveMutex().

xGenericHandle ASyncObject::Detach ( ) [inline, virtual]

Usually a FreeRTOS handle is disposed and his resource freed when the attached object is deleted. Call this method to keep the handle alive.

Returns:
the native FreeRTOS handle. This handle is valid after the object is disposed.

Implements IFreeRTOSObj.

Definition at line 47 of file ASyncObject.h.

bool ASyncObject::IsValid ( ) const [inline, virtual]

Check if the object is attached to a valid FreRTOS native handle.

Returns:
true if the is attached to a valid FreRTOS native handle, false otherwise.

Implements IFreeRTOSObj.
